newsitem.title: POLAND: Polish firemen set fires to gain glory.
newsitem.headline: Polish firemen set fires to gain glory.

text.p: A Polish court sentenced four volunteer firemen to jail on Thursday for setting more than 30 fires so they could win glory and rewards for putting them out.
The arson against homes, farms and forests spread panic in the southeast Poland village of Cmielow from 1993-95, forcing residents to stay up all night guarding their property.

The provincial court in Tarnobrzeg sentenced two men, including the ringleader -- the son of the local fire chief -- to four years in jail and gave the other two shorter suspended terms, court spokesman Jozef Dyl told PAP news agency.
